item.title: Item recolor HELP!
item.dc:creator: @darkness101 darkness101
item.description:
@darkness101 wrote:

Well, IF you know the colors it is easy…

[quote=“Hidendra, post:5, topic:216787”][quote author=magma828 link=topic=284963.msg2309116#msg2309116 date=1214969717]
They could be like the colours used in HTML: http://www.computerhope.com/htmcolor.htm (Ignore the #)

Have a try with the colours there and see if anything works.
[/quote]
Possibly, if you’re going to use HTML colors, at least use them as so:

class8.anIntArray160[1] = 0x######;

Replacing the #'s with the hex.[/quote]

AND NO!!! THERE IS NO LETTERS IN ITEM RECOLORING!!! OMG!!!

Read full topic

Have a try with the colours there and see if anything works.[/quote]

Replacing the #'s with the hex.

item.title: Item recolor HELP!
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

lol i just go to itemdump and search for a wepon or item that has the color i want and iuse it butthe tricky part is figuring out which aninarray has the correct color you want so try a couple of times. and it may not always work so yeah some items have original to changed to
heres some most used colors
black i think is 2000 or 126
dragon red is 926
rune is 36133
white is 100
abby is 528

item.title: Item recolor HELP!
item.dc:creator: @darkness101 darkness101
item.description:
@darkness101 wrote:

I can see that where they get this stuff…

if(i == 1827) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; <----------- class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; <------------- class8.anIntArray156 = new int[3]; <------------- class8.anIntArray160 = new int[3]; <------------- class8.anIntArray156[0] = 22416; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 7097; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 22424; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 7114; class8.anIntArray156[2] = 24; class8.anIntArray160[2] = 43117; class8.anInt174 = 11371; <------------- class8.anInt181 = 1720; <------------- class8.anInt190 = 488; <------------- class8.anInt198 = 0; <------------- class8.anInt204 = 224; <------------- class8.anInt169 = 7; <------------- class8.anInt194 = 5; <------------- class8.anInt165 = 11411; <------------- class8.anInt200 = 11355; <------------- class8.anInt175 = -1; <------------- class8.anInt197 = -1; <------------- class8.aString170 = "Gilded d-hide chaps"; <------------- class8.aByteArray178 = "Golden chaps of 100% dragon hide. Did this come from a golden dragon?".getBytes(); <------------- }
But… WHERE in the world do they know the colors? Is there a chart?

if(i == 1827) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[3]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[3]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 22416; <------------- class8.anIntArray160[0] = 7097; <------------- class8.anIntArray156[1] = 22424; <------------- class8.anIntArray160[1] = 7114; <------------- class8.anIntArray156[2] = 24; <------------- class8.anIntArray160[2] = 43117; <------------- class8.anInt174 = 11371; class8.anInt181 = 1720; class8.anInt190 = 488; class8.anInt198 = 0; class8.anInt204 = 224; class8.anInt169 = 7; class8.anInt194 = 5; class8.anInt165 = 11411; class8.anInt200 = 11355; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.aString170 = "Gilded d-hide chaps"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Golden chaps of 100% dragon hide. Did this come from a golden dragon?".getBytes(); }

I really dont get it… i’ve searched google and moparscape for color ids for this…
But, where do other people get this? And… how do they know the old color id?
Thank you if you helped me!

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 01, 2008, 04:24:22 PM[/size][hr]Does nobody know?

Read full topic
